title: project-setup
text: shiny apps created R packages according structure documented mastering-shiny

title: project-setup
text: shiny.quartz includes several helpers generate shiny app. included utils family shiny.quartz. include use_mod, use_app, use_dev, use_run_app. create new project, normally create new repo initialize git.
code: mkdir test_project cd test_project git init #> hint: Using 'master' as the name for the initial branch. This default branch name #> hint: is subject to change. To configure the initial branch name to use in all #> hint: of your new repositories, which will suppress this warning, call: #> hint:  #> hint:    git config --global init.defaultBranch <name> #> hint:  #> hint: Names commonly chosen instead of 'master' are 'main', 'trunk' and #> hint: 'development'. The just-created branch can be renamed via this command: #> hint:  #> hint:    git branch -m <name> #> Initialized empty Git repository in /home/runner/work/shiny.quartz/shiny.quartz/vignettes/test_project/.git/ pwd  #> /home/runner/work/shiny.quartz/shiny.quartz/vignettes

title: Authors and Citation
text: Jacob Clarke. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Clarke J (2022). shiny.quartz: Component library quartz software based dashboards. R package version 0.0.1, https://github.com/QuartzSoftwareLLC/shiny.quartz.
code: @Manual{,   title = {shiny.quartz: Component library for quartz software based dashboards},   author = {Jacob Clarke},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.0.1},   url = {https://github.com/QuartzSoftwareLLC/shiny.quartz}, }

what: Component library for quartz software based dashboards
title: Component library for quartz software based dashboards
text: Quartz loves mui good shiny dashboard makes best impact powered elegant ui solution. Shiny.quartz builds shiny.mui package add intuitive components. ## Installation

title: Component library for quartz software based dashboards
text: components bear name shiny.mui parents Q prefix. example QCard wrapper Card component. Examples components can found /inst/examples folder.

title: Component library for quartz software based dashboards
text: shiny.react Library used port code, inspired shiny.fluent library material-ui source components library

title: A card for acknowledging the authors of a publication. — AcknowledgementCard
code: AcknowledgementCard(   authors = list(list(name = "Timothy L. Wiemken", src =     "https://media-exp1.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E03AQE4JkLxHi1g7A/profile-displayphoto-shrink_400_400/0/1603549767246?e=1655337600&v=beta&t=mGGA7RxgQvdi0yIvbwiOJXiJ0uvM_YAm0-UuybyOp8g"),     list(name = "Jacob A. Clarke", src =     "https://www.jacobaclarke.com/headshot_new_cropped.jpg", href =     "https://www.jacobaclarke.com/"), list(name = "Christopher Prener"), list(name =     "Verna Welch"), list(name = "John McLaughlin")) )

text: Adds switch boolean values

title: Icon Switch — IconSwitch.shinyInput
text: inputId input id ... args pass element including icon switch value value input

title: Icon Switch — IconSwitch.shinyInput
code: library(shiny.quartz) library(shiny.mui) library(shiny)   if (interactive()) {     shinyApp(         ui = div(             IconSwitch.shinyInput("text", TableViewIcon(), value = T),             textOutput("textValue")         ),         server = function(input, output) {             output$textValue <- renderText({                 sprintf("Value: %s", input$text)             })         }     ) }

title: ListSlider — ListSlider.shinyInput
text: animated slider component takes list options. Value reset options change.

title: ListSlider — ListSlider.shinyInput
text: inputId input id ... args pass element value value default value.

title: ListSlider — ListSlider.shinyInput
code: library(shiny.mui) library(shiny)   if (interactive()) {   shinyApp(     ui = div(       Box(),       ListSlider.shinyInput("val", value = 5, options = seq(1, 10)),       textOutput("textValue"),       ListSlider.shinyInput("multival", value = c(1,5), options = seq(1, 10)),       textOutput("multival")     ),     server = function(input, output) {       output$textValue <- renderText({         sprintf("Value: %s", input$val)       })       output$multival <- renderText({         input$multival       })     }   ) }

QDataGrid — QDataGrid
text: Helper create data grids

title: QDataGrid — QDataGrid
text: data data_frame display height height grid columns configuration individual columns. See mui documentation details minColWidth minimum width columns ... props pass react component. See mui documentation

title: QDataGrid — QDataGrid
code: library(shiny.mui) library(shiny) library(shiny.quartz) data(mtcars)  if (interactive()) {     shinyApp(         ui = div(             reactOutput("data")         ),         server = function(input, output) {             output$data <- renderReact({                 QDataGrid(mtcars, minColWidth = 100)             })         }     ) }

title: Q List Item — QListItem
code: library(shiny.quartz) library(shiny.mui)  component_example(     List(QListItem("first", secondary = "go"), QListItem("second"), QListItem("third")) )

title: Q Select — QSelect.shinyInput
text: Warning. render correctly attatched shiny server.

title: Q Select — QSelect.shinyInput
text: ... args pass element shiny.mui::Select.shinyInput() element options list key value pairs label label display select

title: Q Select — QSelect.shinyInput
code: library(shiny.quartz) library(shiny)   if (interactive()) {     shinyApp(         ui = div(             QSelect.shinyInput("text", fullWidth = T, label = "First One", value = "two", options = make_options("one", "two", "three")),             textOutput("textValue")         ),         server = function(input, output) {             output$textValue <- renderText({                 sprintf("Value: %s", input$text)             })         }     ) }
